evidence.text: Plaintiff National Job Corps Association (“NJCA”) is a 501(c)(6) national member trade organization, founded in 1998...

extracted.value: Plaintiffs include NJCA (trade organization), Adams (employee-owned company), ETR (operator since 1997), API (operates New Orleans campus), Strategix (serves 1,348 students), and TCU (labor union).

evidence.text: Job Corps, established by Congress in 1964, is the nation's largest residential employment and workforce development program for youth. It trains and educates young people, 16 to 24 years old, from disadvantaged backgrounds...

extracted.value: Job Corps was established by Congress in 1964 as the nation's largest residential career training program for disadvantaged youth (16-24 years old), providing vocational training, housing, meals, healthcare, and social skills development.

evidence.text: For example, DOL halted applicant background checks, which effectively prevented new enrollment... On April 11, 2025, DOL discontinued dedicated student Career Transition Readiness (CTR) programs... On April 23, 2025, all pending or outstanding Job Corps procurements except for three were abruptly canceled... On May 29, 2025, DOL had a call with all Job Corps operators to announce its plan to implement stop work orders on all Job Corps contracts nationwide.

extracted.value: DOL halted applicant background checks in March 2025, preventing new enrollment; discontinued Career Transition Readiness programs on April 11, 2025; canceled Job Corps procurements on April 23, 2025; and issued termination notices to all operators on May 29, 2025.

evidence.text: In Program Year 2019, 56.9% of enrollees had no high school diploma or equivalency at program entry... Job Corps students come from disadvantaged backgrounds. Many have faced extreme hardship and instability and came to Jobs Corps for a chance to change their lives. Indeed, thousands of students enrolled at Jobs Corps campuses were either homeless or in foster care prior to Job Corps enrollment.

extracted.value: Approximately 56.9% of Job Corps enrollees in Program Year 2019 had no high school diploma or equivalency at program entry, and many students were homeless or in foster care prior to enrollment.

evidence.text: You shall begin immediately all work necessary to provide a safe, orderly, and prompt shutdown of center operations... require operators to 'immediately take' 'all necessary steps to … separate[] and transport[]' students to their home of records... operators must only retain staff that is 'necessary to accomplish the shutdown or to comply with the orders of [DOL].'

extracted.value: DOL's termination notices required immediate shutdown of centers, removal of students to home of record by June 4, 2025, and termination of all staff except for shutdown-related personnel.
